alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Central and Southern Valley; Garfield; Petroleum; Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 6:10PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Phillips, Petroleum, southwestern Garfield and southwestern Valley Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 609 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Fourchette to 6 miles northeast of U L Bend Rec Area to 15 miles northeast of Winnett. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winnett, Zortman, Sand Springs, Fourchette, U L Bend Rec Area, Crooked Creek Rec Area, Flatwillow, Devils Creek Rec Area, Edwards, Mosby, Brusett, Phillips, Petrolia Lake, Fred Robinson Bridge, Steve Fork, Tiegen, Landusky, Content, Sun Prairie and Cat Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southeast Phillips; Central and Southern Valley; Garfield; Petroleum; Southwest Phillips
